div.l: The wenche routed eke ꝑpar company
Aleyn̄ the clerk / that herd this melody
He pukked Iohn / and seid slepes þᵘou
Herd þᵘou eủere slyke a sang or now
Lo slyke a couplyng is ymell all
A wyld fire / on̄ thair͗e bodies fall
Wha herde eủere slyke a ferly thyng
Yee þey sall haue þe flour of yuell endyng
This lang nyght / ne tydes me na rest
But yitte na force / all sall be for the best
For Iohn seide he / als eủere mot I thryve
Yf that I may yoon̄ lasse shall I swyve
Som̄ easement has lawe shapen vs
For Iohn there is a lawe þat seith thus
That gyf a man in a poynt be greved
That in another he sall be releued
Our͗e corn̄ is stolen sothly it is na nay
And we han hade an yuell fitte this day
And sen̄ I sall haue none amendement
Agayn̄ my losse I sall haue an easement
By goddes soule / it sall noon̄ other be
This Iohn answerd Alayn̄ avise the
The myller is a ꝑperlious man he seid
And gyf that he / out of his slepe breid
He myght do vs baath a velanye
Aleyn̄ answerd / I count hym nat a flye
Vp he rist and by the wench he crepte
This wenche lay vp right and fast slepte
Tyll / he so nye was / or she myghte espye
That it hade ben̄ to late / for to crye
And shortly for to sey / þey were at oon̄
Now play Aleyn̄ / for I woll speke of Iohn
¶ This Iohn lyth still a furlong wey or · ij ·
And to hym self / he maketh reuth and wo
Allas koth he / this is a wykked iape
Now may I sey / that I is but an ape
Yitte haas my felaw somwhat for his harme
He haas the myllers doughter in his arme
He auntred hym / and haas his nedes spedde
And I lye as a draffe sak in my bedde
And whan this Iape is told another day
